text: was there any updates to the backend of HubSpot, some of our Include HTML files have new code in the DM that were not there when we were using local CLI tools
Do you have an example of the new code?

well just wondering if there were releases today that can be highlighted, first off across multiple files in DM we are seeing in HTML files
```<!--
  templateType: "page"
  isAvailableForNewContent: false
-->```
we are using an _ENV.html (environmental file which is not a true page) to use variables for files, but now the import syntax cannot find our file:
this code was all working on Friday
there were no warnings
we would import the _ENV.html on the Site settings of the domain:
```{% import "/_ENV.html" as ENV %}```
cc <@UBDMV6Y9Y>
our template partial footer housing multiple footer references to different country footers but they all are throwing an warning error:
Can you send me a link to the template?
so before I was able to add this code to the Site Settings of the whole site:
```{% import "/_ENV.html" as ENV %}```
but seems like I have add the same reference in the global html file at the top so the variables can be read
What is your account ID?
<https://app.HubSpot.com/design-manager/7070839/code/25350819590>
if u look at revisions of that file, u will see how there was not code at the top before, there were never error messages before:
Strange I am not seeing any errors in <https://app.HubSpot.com/design-manager/7070839/code/25350819590>

no because I had to fix it to figure out what was happening, I never had to include this:
{% import “/_ENV.html” as ENV %}, in this file before, it was applied on the Site Settings domain level and everything worked fine

there was an update done by HubSpot that also added this code at the top of all the files:
```<!--
  templateType: "page"
  isAvailableForNewContent: false
-->```

I don’t believe templates incorporate site settings, that is only brought in at the page level. So the template itself wouldn’t preview but it should still work at the page level where the site settings are pulled in

<@U6GNQ7JBU>, I also removed that ENV reference so u can see the error, overall what I am saying whatever update that was rolled out by HS Engineers #1) added that pageTemplate code to the top of HTML files (because it was not there before), #2 the Site Settings domain area where I have put the import, basically stopped working globally on other files
That added comment at the top of the file has to do with the new `<https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/building-blocks/templates/html-hubl-templates>` template annotations
It’s possible this somehow caused unpredicted side effects
Still digging

I also think it has to do with a Hubpost email I got about domain management: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/cms/domains?utm_source=hs_email&utm_medium=email&utm_content=85904320&_hsenc=p2ANqtz-8doMRAP427JByjba-aBsY2tFjHCH2tERjDZ1C0rswMRHOiGV_wFWLKnN7_s59ipXjU-_RG1nh7-Rza6GVgSTyyamITOBj1VnojsRAlqU7cTvuQ18M&_hsmi=85904320>
please let me know what u find out
